definition: to beat a gong
to hit/to strike/to tap/to rap/to knock/to rip sb off/to overcharge
gong/CL:面[mian4]
to strike the edge of the gong/(fig.) to stir the pot (i.e. cause or exacerbate a dispute)

sentences.english: The villagers beat drums and lit firecrackers.
sentences.chinese: 村民們敲鑼打鼓放鞭炮。

sentences.english: On news of approaching enemy aircraft a gong sounded to warn the inhabitants.
sentences.chinese: 當敵人飛機來臨時用敲鑼的方式通知民衆。

sentences.english: There were old people , young people; they beat the drums through the day.
sentences.chinese: 其中有老人，也有年輕人，他們整天都在敲鑼打鼓。

sentences.english: What, just for banging a gong?
sentences.chinese: 什麼，僅僅因爲我敲鑼了？

sentences.english: There are dragon dances with drums.
sentences.chinese: 也會敲鑼打鼓的舞龍燈。

sentences.english: The teacher rang a gong; it was time for lunch.
sentences.chinese: 老師開始敲鑼，午飯時間到了。

sentences.english: Drumming is not the way to catch a hare.
sentences.chinese: 靠敲鑼打鼓抓不到兔子。

sentences.english: In China, people may play the gong and the drum during the traditional festivals.
sentences.chinese: 在中國，人們在逢年過節時會敲鑼打鼓。

hissing sound/to hiss (as a sign of displeasure)

to sound a bell/(of a clock) to chime
